headline: Red, White and Blue Strawberry Shortcake
description: This yellow cake is frosted with whipped topping and decorated with blueberries and strawberries for the stars and stripes on the American flag.

video.description: This patriotic cake is perfect for Fourth of July picnics.
video.name: Red, White, and Blue Strawberry Shortcake

name: Red, White and Blue Strawberry Shortcake
recipeIngredient: 1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed
2 pints fresh strawberries, rinsed and sliced

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare cake according to package directions and bake in a 9x13 inch pan. Cool completely.
Frost cake with whipped topping. Place blueberries in a square in the corner, and arrange sliced strawberries as stripes to make an American flag. Chill until serving.

review.reviewBody: With everything going on with our BBQ and guests...LOTS of guests!...I got lazy and went to my local supermarket which had a bakery. I bought a full-sheet plain white cake and decorated it my self. I did kinda go over-board on the decorations but it came out kinda cool!

Not perfect, but delicious!! Used suggestions. Chocolate cake goâ€™s great with cool whip. Especially when it has vanilla pudding in it. Thank you for the recipe and the suggestions. Happy 4th of July.
Made it as directed and for the topping I did as Better suggested and mixed vanilla pudding and vanilla in with the cool whip. Much thicker consistency. Very very good!!
I've made this a few times now and it's always a big hit!
Just darn good!
This cake is so easy to make, very light and so delicious! It was a huge hit for our July 4th gathering! I will be making this again for sure! Thank you!
No changes, I would make it again!!!
Thank you so much this was nice and easy I am definitely making it next year
It was awesome turned out exactly how I wanted it
I was the star of the evening with this gorgeous yet incredibly simple, light cake.
Easy to make cake and festive! I followed the recipe to the tee, the whipped cream adds a fresh taste!

I make it with white cake mix instead of yellow. I also made this with a strawberry & blueberry "compote"ish like filling on top of the cake. I placed that on after it cooled. I made it like one does any "compote" Then I layered the whipped topping and added the berries for decorative purposes. My family and friends ATE IT UP!!! It's a really good recipe. Like any other it just needs your personal touch. :)
Great recipe! Everyone loved it! Great for 4th of July or the Olympics!
easy, super quick, tastes good. just don't overcook the box cake to be too dry.
Whole family loved it and have asked me to make it again. Not too heavy or too sweet. Perfect summer dessert!
So moist and light! I added orange zest to the cake mix in the form of Doterra's wild orange essential oil. Gave it a nice citrus kick.

I made it with a super moist white cake mix and did homemade whip topping since no one in my house like Cool Whip. Turned out light and very moist. Everyone love3d it. It was gone by the end of the evening.
I used chocolate cake mix instead but came out perfect!:)
Very easy to make and perfect for the 4th of July!

Excellent presentation! Just made this for a Memorial Day BBQ. The kids got a huge kick out of a flag cake. I used a double chocolate cake (what I had on hand) instead and the cool whip frosting from this site. Everyone enjoyed it! Thank you for a quick recipe which looks like I spent an hour making!
I made this cake, but tore it into pieces and made a trifle and put my flag on the top. It was pretty and it was tasty!
the cool whip is a good topping

The 4th is ALWAYS a busy day. People coming and going, to the park and back, fire works and a million dishes on the table! I wanted to make a delicious patriotic desert but also didn't want to be tied up in the kitchen long. This was perfect and I think I'll make it every year! I made the cake the night before (while its cool enough to fire up the oven), frosted it the next morning and put the berries on about a half hour before guests started to arrive. I also made the frosting with the vanilla pudding mix as others suggested. I put rows in strawberries and blueberries instead of making a flag. It still looked very patriotic and every bite had a strawberry and blueberry. I got tons of compliments. I mean...this isn't my Grandpas famous apple pie or my Grandmas famous sugar cookies...but it IS a quick, attractive tasty cake for a 4th of July BBQ!
I added zest of one lemon and used cream cheese frosting instead of cool-whip. Don't rinse the berries, it makes the frosting all goopy. Everyone loved it, though!

I made this cake as others suggested using instant pudding in the cool whip frosting. It was a fan favorite for the fourth of July. Instead of using a white or yellow cake, I used a lemon cake that made this dessert refreshing and off set the sweet from the fruit and sugar. Overall, a very good cake.
An awesome recipe for patriotic holidays!
This cake is super easy, and perfect for a Memorial Day or 4th of July picnic. It was a great hit!

Simple, pretty, nothing particularly unique however. Do make sure your berries are well-drained after slicing, or you will have a drippy mess on your cake top! Nice for a party, not too heavy in the summer.
wonderful

This was super easy and cheap :) the longest part was letting the cake cool. I recommend using a rectangular pan. I didn't think about that til afterwards. It just would've looked better. Don't skimp on the whipped cream.
I loved the way reviewer BETTE did it. I did one on the 4th and again the next day for a gathering. It was gone both times I kid you not. Highly recommend.

Delicious! I made this for our 4th of July BBQ and it was a big hit! Everyone thought it tasted like twinkies. The young kids had fun helping me decorate it. The only change I made was to use heavy whipping cream and made our own by adding a tsp. of sugar and vanilla! Will definitely make again! Thanks!

For a great way to get a beginner, in the kitchen that wants to do something fun, is this recipe. One of my kids wanted to make something for a gathering and I suggested this because it's quick, fun and easy. And boy did she have fun making it. Now she was requested to make again but with a chocolate cake for someone's birthday. Made the cake even cooler was adding red and blue sprinkles into the cake mix made it sparkle holiday fun. Thanks again, we will totally make again. But sans the homemade whip topping. ;-)

Great recipe and super cute! I added 1 package vanilla pudding mix, 2 tsp. vanilla extract 1 cup of milk & 2 Tbsp. brown sugar to the icing like some others had suggested which was perfect. Next year, I'll use angel food cake instead of yellow cake...I think that'd be worthy of 5 stars.

I made this the night before a 4th of July BBQ, and I was worried it might get mushy or the fruit might color the frosting overnight, but it turned out really good. In fact, I thought I overbaked my cake (used the convection feature for the first time ever), but it was quite moist and tasty when I got it out of the refrigerator the next day. 
I am not a big fan of Cool Whip, so like several other reviewers, I used the Cool Whipped Frosting from this site, and it was wonderful. 
I served it cold at a pool party, and we all thought it was very refreshing!

This was great! Made it for a party and got raves. Will make for another party soon. Different people but I am sure they will like it too. I used real whipped cream. I thought this took the cake up a notch.
Great shortcake taste!

Nom nom nom. We used a yellow cake and followed the recommendation to use the Whip Cream Vanilla frosting....take the 8oz of cool whip, fold a package of instant vanilla pudding, 1c milk and 1 tsp of vanilla and it was so perfect. Not just for the 4th....all sorts of fruits can be used....kiwi, blackberry, raspberry, boysenberry - etc. We kept the left over frosting for a dip. Super moist and delicious cake!

I made this last evening ...for 4th of July brunch. I used 2 pound cake mixes & took the advice of CHICK and poked holes in cooled cake and filled with concentrated strawberry jello. The jello added a lot more berry flavor. Yummmm...everyone dug right in and ate every morsel.

I basically used the recipe but I added additional strawberries with sugar (so it made a syrup) and put it on the cake before I frosted with the whipped topping. Then added the flag blueberries & strawberries on top.

This recipe is very plain and simple. My recipe uses two boxes yellow cake mix baked in jelly roll pan. Whipping cream with powdered sugar and chopped strawberries goes between layers, frost with whipped cream, then use 50 blueberries in upper corner, sliced bananas dipped in lemon juice for one row; alternate rows using strawberry halves to make the stars and stripes. It is huge and feeds a group on July 4th and tastes like a gourmet strawberry shortcake ala Independence Day. Change to two boxes yellow cake mix, 2 pints heavy whipping cream, use wax paper on jelly roll pan, grease paper.

I made this last 4th of July for our family get together, and it was great! I only made one change: I put a layer of fresh sliced strawberries on the cake before frosting it with the whipped cream. I will definitely be making it again this year!
My family loved this! I had extra strawberries and blueberries I served as well. Easy and simple.

This cake was delicious. I followed some of the other reviews and poked holes in the cake and added strawberry gelatin mixed with 1 cup of hot water. I refrigerated cake overnight and frosted with cool whip the next day plus added strawberries. Not a fan of blueberries so I used blue decorative icing to draw stars.
This one is soooo easy and always a big hit on the 4th of July, Memorial Day and Veterans Day!!
Tastes great! I'd love to see a new 4th of July cake design though this one is kind of put away wet at this point.

THIS RECIPE MAKES UP VERY QUICKLY. I USED A WHITE CAKE MIX AND ADDED A BOX OF VANILLA INSTANT PUDDING. T MADE A WHIPPED CREAM, CREAMCHEESE FROSTING AND IT HELD UP FOR THE 4TH AND THE PART I FROZE WAS STILL PERFECT.
I used white cake mix and loved it

Darling festive cake! Got lots of oohs and awwws. Use the vanilla pudding in the cool whip. Makes a great topping. I also used white cake mix cooked and cooled then poked holes every couple of inches and poured strawberry jello small pack made with 1 cup of boiling water mixed then added 1/2 cup of ice cold water mixed then poured over cake so it was marbled. Cooled for an hour in fridge. Then frosted and decorated. It was a hit!!!
My family and guests loved it! It was easy to make and did not take a lot of time to make.

I just made this for 4th of July and divided the batter into 2 8" square cake pans. So instead of making a flag for the decoration I made a star. Outlined it with blueberries and filled with sliced strawberries. It was fantastic! Really did taste like shortcake - maybe because when the cake is refrigerated it takes on more of a shortcake texture. Anyway, it was delish! And my whole family enjoyed. Even the little ones from ages 4-9. Thanks for a great, simple and easy recipe! Mema328
Festive and easy! I used red velvet cake mix which went well with Cool Whip topping.
This is a nice easy recipe for someone like me who can't bake!!! I used the pudding mix as well in the frosting. No one could believe I made it!!
This was fantastic. I used the Lemon Cake by LaDonna as the base. It worked great! Everyone loved it and were impressed.

This was OK...I would probably have liked it better if I had not added the vanilla and pudding to the Cool Whip as other reviewers suggested. That added a real artificial taste to it. Next time I will stick with the recipe...I have made this before as written and the Cool Whip alone is just OK on top, which is why I opted for the moderations this time. Either way it's just a 3 star recipe.

It would have been good, but not fantastic with just the cool-whip topping, but I would give 5-stars with the suggestion from Bette to add pudding, milk, and vanilla to the topping. It was just the extra touch needed to make it special for the holiday!

Oh, and we're a family of raspberry lovers so I used raspberries instead of sliced strawberries. The key is to wash them well ahead of time and keep turning them in the collander to make sure the water drains out so they're ready to put on your cake.

I loved making this because it was easy to decorate. Instead of using cool whip for the frosting I used butter cream because I am not fond of cool whip for a frosting on cakes. It's a very festive idea for when your feeling patriotic or for a special occasion like today which is the 4th of July. I made this for a party.

I used a Butter Recipe cake mix. I also beat 3 ozs cream cheese with a couple of tablespoons of sugar and added it to the whipped topping to give it a little more body. Thanks for the decorating idea, made a nice July 4th presentation! I'm sharing my photo.

I made this cake a long time ago. I put strawberries into the cake as well as decorate it on top. It was a HUGE hit and gone by the end of the day. Pretty and festive, with fresh fruit, you can't go wrong and its's so easy to make.

I have made this cake for over 15 years. I use white cake instead and add some color, flavor and texture by using a berry gelatin mix mixed with one cup hot water. I poke holes in cooled cake and pour gelatin mix over and refridgerate over night before adding cool-whip and decorations.
i loved this cake i followed everything and it was AMAZING!!! thankyou this is a new family tradition(:
My daughters ( 11yrs & 9yrs)made this cake all by themselves for the fourth of July. It's an easy cake for kids and beginning chefs to do. It tastes great too :)
Came out great. Big size for 2 people. This is a give away cake.

I baked the cake as directed, allowed to cool, poked holes with shish kebab skewer, and spread top with strawberry glaze: 2/3 c strawberry jelly & 1 t lemon juice, stirred together in saucepan over low heat till jelly dissolves. Then cover glaze with whipped topping & fruit.
I made this for our annual July 4th party. It went quickly and everyone loved it. I substituted the yellow cake mix and used white which uses egg whites instead of whole eggs. Yummy!

I looked over all of the reviews, and created into my own. First off, in the past when I have made this, it always seems to overflow the dish, so I baked the cake and transfered into a larger dish to decorate. I covered the cake with a can of strawberry and a can of blueberry pie filling. Then covered that with the cool whip blend doubled (16oz cool whip, 2tsp vanilla, 2 cups milk, 2 small boxs instant vanilla pudding). I decorated that with fresh blueberries and strawberries. It was a huge hit and well enjoed by all!

First time making this cake and it was a hit! Everyone loved it. I did take others advise and used the frosting with the pudding in the mix and im glad i did. I also used a vanilla cake box mix and it was yummy.
Made this for the 4th of july everyone loved it!! :D

This was my first cake ever. I decided this year to be daring and do something new for the Fourth. Because I am a newbee to baking I messed up the first layer because of impatience and excitment. My hubby said:"Baby, let it cool in the oven and calm down." :-) Second layer fell right out. The only thing I did different was I thought an orange cake would compliment the blueberries and strawberries and it did! I did use the cool whip and pudding recipe that I found on this site. Next time I'm going to use the white chocolate pudding. Nothing like chocolate and fruit! I love this website.

I make a cake like this on all holiday pot-lucks. The only change is, I make my own yellow cake. I also bake it in a 13x9 pan. The whipped topping is a perfect icing. It holds up very well to room temperature. It also isn't too sweet like traditional icing. 13x9 pans, now sometimes come with covers. It makes it nice and easy to store before of after a party too.

Really pretty cake! I used a German Choc box cake, and the COOL WHIPPED FROSTING from this site. I took other's advice and made a layer cake, using the cool whipped frosting (doubled the recipe) and put strawberries and blueberries in the middle layer. I used French Vanilla pudding with the frosting - DUH, forgot that pudding was yellow, so we had a yellow, red, and blue cake. :D Yummy and fun, nothing fancy. Will definitely make again!
So quick and easy!! Looked and tasted great!!!!!!!!!! Enjoyed by all , Thankyou !!!!!!!!!! =)
Perfect for the holiday. Everyone loved it. I made it with a funfetti angle food cake and it worked perfectly. Nice and light for a hot summer night.
Was a big hit at our picnic. I made this as a poke cake with strawberry jello and frosted with a recipe I had that is sour cream, powdered sugar and cool whip.

WOW! This was a definite hit w/the kids. Followed recipe as written with one exception. As another had done, I poked holes in cake after it came out of oven and poured 1 can (14 oz) of fat free sweetened condensed milk over the top. AWESOME DESSERT!!!!!

I was looking to make a quick dessert and I happened to have all these things on hand! All my guests thought the flag was adorable, and devoured it, but I personally thought it was missing just a little something, although I cannot think of what that something is. It tasted good, in the future I will make my own cake batter. I don't like box cake.
Awesome cake! I used yellow cake mix. I used 3/4 cup milk, and 1/4 cup water (instead of 1 cup water) and added a cup of jello vanilla pudding. Amazing
If you want to make this phenomenal, cut the cake horizontally, and add strawberry pie filling... yum!

Great twist on an old favorite. I made exactly as directed. It was super easy and quite tasty. If you wanted you could make the cake from scratch for an even more home-made flavor. But as-is, it's good!

Used this recipe for my son's cub scout - mother and son bake off with a theme of "Patriotism". We did not win but a cake exactly like mine won :o)) Same as the other suggestions I used the cool whipped frosting recipe on this site too and it turned out nice and tasty. Thank you for the recipe!
It was super easy and delicious!!
I got rave reviews on this recipe! Everyone loved the light texture of the coolwhip with the cake and the fresh berries. I plan on making this again for valentines with macerated strawberries.

I pretty much made this festive cake, except I used angelfood cake. Although the angelfood made the cake really airy & refreshing, I didn't exactly have the proper sized pans because it won't cook in 1 "standard" 9x13 cake pan. I improvized by using 2 loaf pans, so my rectangle flag was a little square shaped. So, just be aware that if you want to go with angelfood, just check your pan sizes ahead of time. Happy 4th of July!!!

Made this for a fourth of july party. By the end of the party the cake was all gone. Everyone loved it and thought it was really cute (even though it's not as pretty as some others on here). Thanks for sharing the recipe.
This recipe was great! I would make it again in a heart-beat. My family loved it.
So good! I love the yellow cake as the base. yummmy!
Fun festive treat, got lots of compliments. Super easy, and I even let my 4 year old put the blueberries on. She loved it. I think this will become a 4th of July tradition!
Slice strawberries in halve.

I made this for two 4th of July parties this year. The first time, I followed the recipe exactly and it was delicious. The second time, I used chocolate cake and it was even better. I definitely will make again.
This was very easy, quick, not much work and tasted good. Looked great for 4th of July also. I like that it was less sweet than most cakes with loads of regular cake icing.

My daughter and I made this cake for the 4th of July this year. She decorated it all by herself and it looked amazing. She got a lot of compliments on it. 

Taste - it was sooooo moist. Absolutely delicious! We used a Betty Crocker box mix and followed the directions exactly on the box. One 8 oz container of cool whip is just enough to do the job too. 

Definitely, a keeper recipe for us!
I added white chocolate pudding to the topping! It was really good with that!

Served this to the twins and Charlie, Will, Blake, Manny and Laurel, Em and Mark, plus me, Ray, & Emily Gilpin for the Fourth. Manny and Mark cooked burgers, brats and hot dogs, we added a few sides, the twins made this cake, staying with Cool Whip instead of real whipped cream, like we usually do - it still was good.

Such an easy and fun cake! Everyone at my 4th of July party loved it. I made a yellow cake from scratch, but I'm sure a packaged yellow cake would taste great too. The decoration on it was adorable, a huge hit, and incredibly easy! I only needed about half the pint of blueberries, and used a little less strawberries than what was called for, but they made cute extras for a side of extra fruit!
made it as written and took it to a July 4th party. Everybody loved it. Thanks for the recipe
add 8 oz of cream cheese and 2TBs of sugar to half the cool whip and you will not regret it!!!!!

This is my family's fav summer dessert. I do place a layer of strawberries mixed with a small amount of glaze on top of the cooled cake. Also, have been using Cool whip frosting from this site. It holds up better than just cool whip.
Easy and delicious...
I've made this cake many times and it's beautiful as well as delicious. I usually make it with chocolate cake but whatever cake you choose will be fine. So easy and fun for kids to do!
